abstract: With only hours to go in an Arctic research cruise, scientists are collecting as many bits of information about seafloor geology as they can, even if it's not yet clear how it will all fit together.
snippet: With only hours to go in an Arctic research cruise, scientists are collecting as many bits of information about seafloor geology as they can, even if it's not yet clear how it will all fit together.
lead_paragraph: Bernard Coakley, a marine geologist with the University of Alaska at Fairbanks, writes from the Arctic Ocean, where his team is reconstructing the geologic history of the Chukchi Shelf and the Chukchi Borderland.

headline.main: Scooping Up Data as the Clock Ticks
